User Requests¶

SALTS uses the following class to handle user requests.

class src.request.user_request.Request(user_req_json)¶

This class manages the sanitization and storage of user defined request data. An abstract class is used for validation, which is implemented in request type-specific subclasses.

Parameters:

user_req_json (str) – JSON string object from user, to be validated and turned into a dictionary.

field_exists(field_name)¶

Checks to confirm if a field exists in the initial user request.

Parameters:

field_name (str) – The name of the field being checked.

Return type:

boolean

get_clean_data_dict()¶

Getter for clean data formatted as a dict.

Returns:

Dictionary of validated data.

Return type:

dict

get_clean_data_json()¶

Getter method for clean data converted to a JSON-formatted string.

Returns:

Validated data as a JSON string object.

Return type:

str

get_configs()¶

Gets business rules for each field from config and returns them as a dictionary.

Returns:

Contents of the request_fields.json config file formatted as a dictionary.

Return type:

dict

has_cost()¶

Checks to confirm if the cost field exists in clean data. Used as a flag in the database API layer.

Return type:

boolean

has_expiration()¶

Checks to confirm if the date of expiration field exists in clean data. Used as a flag in the database API layer.

Return type:

boolean

has_restrictions()¶

Checks to confirm if the restrictions field exists in clean data. Used as a flag in the database API layer.

Return type:

boolean

abstract validate_data()¶

Abstract method to force implementation of data validation by request specific subclasses.

validate_field(field_key)¶

Validates request fields based on config file values.

Parameters:

field_key (str) – The name of the field to validate.

Raises:

ValueError – If the field is found to be invalid.
